overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. LinkedIn boasts the largest follower base, but engagement varies across platforms. His content includes research announcements, hiring opportunities, and conference participation.

contentThemes.description: Sharing updates on research projects, publications, and new tools.
Posts advertising job openings within the research team.
Discussion of methods and research opportunities within this field.
Analysis and discussion surrounding disinformation and coordinated inauthentic behavior.

recommendations: Tailor content to each platform. LinkedIn is more professional, while Bluesky and Mastodon allow for more informal engagement.
Increase the frequency of posts on Mastodon to foster a stronger community.
Use more visuals (images, videos) to increase engagement.
Actively participate in conversations and respond to comments to build stronger relationships with followers.
Experiment with different posting times to optimize for peak engagement.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a good balance of research announcements and opportunities, leading to decent reposts. Focus on community building and fostering discussions.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has a smaller audience but is relevant to the research community. Engagement is relatively low; consider posting more frequently and initiating discussions.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is the most popular platform with a large professional network. Capitalize on this by posting career-related content and research updates.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
